channel.title: 3Buoys1Brunch
channel.description:
3 brothers, one Mother and we fucking love Brunch!
This is the swashbuckling tale of the three Brothers Buoy, fans of brunch and good times all. Check in with them 'pon every Friday, and be regaled with stories of food, drink and merriment at restaurants all 'cross the great Isle of Manhattan and its fair Boroughs.
channel.itunes:author: The Brothers Buoy
channel.itunes:summary: This is the swashbuckling tale of the three Brothers Buoy, fans of brunch and good times all. Check in with them 'pon every fortnight Friday, and be regaled with stories of food, drink and merriment at restaurants all 'cross the great Isle of Manhattan and its fair Boroughs.

item.title: Leftovers : Creek and the Cave
item.description: Throwing a bit of a curveball at you this week, dear listeners. Today we have a special mid-week edition of our podcast that we call, The Leftovers. These are conversations that could not fit in the proper brunch cast but we want to include anyway because they are worthwhile conversations with our awesome guests. This week, we continue our conversation with Dillon Birdsall. Check it out!
item.itunes:subtitle: We said it would be on the way and now it is here. Today's episode of the Leftovers features our guest, Dillon Birdsall. Not only does he answer the Buoy Q's, but he brings questions of his own...

item.title: Creek and the Cave
item.description: Oh hey everyone. Get ready for. Special edition of The Brothers Buoy present: 3Buoys1Brunch! Today we are in a new neighborhood: Long Island City! We came with one of our good friends, Dillon Birdsall, who is in the middle of making an awesome documentary called V-Card. Listen in as we talk about what we all thought of the place then stay tuned for a special edition of The Leftovers, coming out later this week!
item.itunes:subtitle: Today The Brothers Buoy have a special guest. Dillon Birdsall is here to talk about his film, V-Card.

item.title: Between the Brunch : Episode 22
item.description: So what you gotta do is follow these steps: download this episode, listen to it with the highest quality audio system available to you, then experience the life changing effects of this new episode of Between the Brunch! Anything you dream can be yours! Especially hiring your own person chef to entertain you! It can all be achieved within, so come inside!
item.itunes:subtitle: The Brother Buoy are in rare form yet again as they tackle local food ordering services and the Mud truck vanishing from Astor Place.

item.title: Jimmys
item.description: Hey what's up gang? Are you ready for another episode of The Brothers Buoy present: 3Buoys1Brunch? We know you are! And boy are you in for a good one! This week, the Buoys are off to Jimmy's in Greenpoint. This place had one of the best dishes that we have had to date, an awesome atmosphere and some pretty great cocktails too, so pop those 'phones in and have a listen!
item.itunes:subtitle: Graham decides to wear Tom's with no socks, Kit fights sodium and Jackson loses his shit when Graham can't figure out his ingredients.

item.title: Between the Brunch : Episode 21
item.description: Hey Boys and Girls. You know what time it is? Its BUOY TIME!! Put the pedal down and gird your loins for another episode of The Brothers Buoy Present: Between the Brunch! This week, Graham stays super quiet while Kit and Jackson talk about all things cupcakes, chips, and 90s music! So slide on into your favorite chair, pop on those headhpones and prepare to drift away into another Buoy filled escape! Love ya!
item.itunes:subtitle: Graham is missing in action, so Jackson and Kit fill your ear holes in the 21st episode of the best side bitch podcast in America!

item.title: Schiller's Liquor Bar
item.description: Oh boy! America keeps on giving, celebrating it's birthday for a whole dang week with The Brothers Buoy! This week, we head out for brunch on the 4th with a plan to try again for our old pal Clinton Street Bakery, but with the sentence of a three hour wait, we went elsewhere. Schiller's Liquor Bar it was and what a grand time we had. All was well except for all the traitors in the place who were watching soccer. So un-patriotic! Check out this ep today!
item.itunes:subtitle: The Brothers Buoy are trekking to the Lower East Side on a rainy ass 4th of July.

item.title: Between the Brunch : Episode 20
item.description: Oh no we didn't! Guess what it's time for? It's A Buoys Independence Day!!! Happy 4th to you all! We are so happy to have one of our favorite holidays fall on a Buoy day! So get ready for a Between the Brunch! Episode 20 no less. In this episode we give you a run down of some 4th festivities, and do a little moniker housekeeping! Also don't forget to check out our 4th of July video that dropped today. Get it!
item.itunes:subtitle: Stand back and marvel at the 4th of July edition by The Brothers Buoy!

item.title: Brooklyn Label
item.description: Well how-de-do and whats shakin to ya on this glorious Buoy Friday! Wake up and smell the brunch, cause here come our boys with another steaming hot episode of 3Buoys1Brunch. This week, the bros travel far up into Greenpoint to visit the neighborhood staple, Brooklyn Label. Pop those 'phones in and don't worry about that smelly homeless guy in the corner of the train cause you're about to be whisked away to brunch paradise. Enjoy!
item.itunes:subtitle: This week The Brothers Buoy travel to Greenpoint Brooklyn to review the brunch at a neighborhood staple, Brooklyn Label.

item.title: Between the Brunch : Episode 19
item.description: Hey you! Take heed! A new Buoys dawns today! Yes it's true, tell your friends! The Buoys ride again in a new episode of Between the Brunch! Today's episode: Jack Buoy was extremely tired, and the other bros try their best to compensate! Also the World Cup of Food! But for real, we got something big planned for everyone coming up very soon so take a listen and get all the deets and so much more! Friday is Buoy day!!!
item.itunes:subtitle: Listen as the Buoys pull out another theme song by JBlue, Jackson is tired/delirious, and Graham tells us about the world cup...of food!

item.title: Clover Club
item.description: So what do you get when you take three brothers that love food, send them to brunch for a year and a half and then put them in front if a microphone? You get 50 episodes of 3 Buoys 1 Brunch!!! Welcome to episode 50 of the best brunch-cast on the web! This week we trek out to the historic Clover Club and had one of the best times in a long time. Check this weeks ep out on iTunes, the website or stitcher and don't forget to rate and subscribe on iTunes. Have a great day!
item.itunes:subtitle: Can you believe it? The Brothers Buoy are 50 episodes in and picking up steam. Thanks for all the support!

item.title: Between the Brunch : Episode 18
item.description: Oh what what what? It's that time again, for your boys Huey, Dewey and Louie to bring the pain on another episode of Between the Brunch! This week: we revise the show based on some audience feedback and ramp it up to 11 to give you lot one of the best efforts from your Buoys in a while. Tune in to hear some brand new segments and some musical stylings on this very special, very Buoy show.
item.itunes:subtitle: "Let the dawn have it's way" because it's time to blast off with the Buoys. We hope you are ready because we are coming with an old school style, yet a fresh vision for this episode of Between the Brunch!

item.title: Miriam
item.description: Oh my goodness, oh my damn! 3 Buoys commin at ya like never before! Lay down on the grass in the sweet sunshine and get ready for a serenade! This week: the gangs all here for a return to form brunch review! We head to Park Slope, a new neighborhood for the Buoys, to visit Miriam, our second Mediterranean spot. So get comfy and listen to the sweet sounds. You won't regret it!
item.itunes:subtitle: Load up the dramatic music, this might be the worst review that the Buoys have ever done....

item.title: Between the Brunch : Episode 17
item.description: Hey you. Yea you. What are you doing this very instant? Because even if you're delivering a baby for a woman who has gone into labor in a water park you should drop everything, pop your earbuds in and listen to a brand new episode of Between the Brunch. This week, the boys are back together talking about Memorial Day events around the city, the capitalization of a tragedy, more nautical idioms and a Yelp review to boot. Get at it!
item.itunes:subtitle: Graham Buoy returns to reconnect the nautical triumvirate!

item.title: Five Leaves
item.description: Whoops! Well gosh darnit, ya went and stepped in a hot fresh episode of 3 Buoys 1 Brunch! Wipe off your shoes and pop in your 'phones, cause ooooh baby, it's a good one. This weeks adventure took us to the ever crowded Five Leaves in Greenpoint. And, stepping in for Graham this week, we brought along our good friend Chris, a native Californian, to taste what this place had to offer. Have a listen!
item.itunes:subtitle: Are you hipster enough for Five Leaves? Well you might not have to worry about that after-all. Listen as the Bouys review the well-known hipster destination.

item.title: Between the Brunch : Episode 16
item.description: Hey all! It's another BTB! This time ya just got Kit and Jacks. But worry not, it's gonna be great! This episode: what's up with tinder, drone drop grilled cheese, some nautical idioms, and more leisure cruise! Check it!
item.itunes:subtitle: The crazy Buoy's attempt to make it without their dear brother Graham. Jackson and Kit are coming at ya between the brunch!

item.title: Freeman's
item.description: This week, The Brothers Buoy visit Freeman's in Manhattan to see what all the buzz is about at the end of Freeman's alley. Listen as they discuss some solid drinks, food and there is even an app recommendation thrown in for good measure.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Brothers are without a guest today, so sit back and fill your earholes with an episode in the classic format. The Buoys take to Manhattan to visit Freeman's. Don't get lost in the alley!

item.title: Between the Brunch : Episode 15
item.description: God damn if it isn't a Buoy-packed week for ya! Today, it's back to the old Between the Brunch. This week, the boys are back in rare form as they discuss Guy Fieri's new Vegas restaurant Kit and Jackson tell a tale of woe from a local fast food establishment, and a new music revelation is discovered. Pop those ear buds in and snuggle up to your neighbor. It's Buoys time!
item.itunes:subtitle: Get ready for another episode of Between the Brunch. Don't forget to find the Brothers Buoy in social media @3Buoys1Brunch

item.title: The Leftovers : Monument Lane
item.description: Hey all! We are debuting a new special edition segment we have deemed The Leftovers! Now that we have begun having awesome guests, we sometimes have leftover conversations that may not quite fit into the regular show. This is a place to highlight those conversations and still keep the show to a digestible length! Enjoy this edition of The Leftovers!
item.itunes:subtitle: Get excited, the Brothers Buoy have another segment to fill your earholes with.

item.title: Monument Lane
item.description: It's Friday, which means another round of 3Buoys1Brunch! Today, The Brothers Buoy venture to the West Village to see what Monument Lane (103 Greenwich Ave, New York, NY 10014) brings to the table. If you thought that they were done having guests, then you should tighten the rope. Today's guests are the founders of Suits & Sandals, an evolutionary agency.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Brother's Buoy gather in the West Village to see what Monument Lane is all about. Today, they are joined by the founders of Suits & Sandals.

item.title: Between the Brunch - Episode 14
item.description: Oh man y'all is in for it today. Welcome to another episode of Between the Brunch: the Triumphant Return of Kit Buoy edition! With the trio complete once again, get ready for one of our longest episodes yet. The bros had a lot to catch up on! This weeks topics: overhyped restaurants, rat turds in our cronuts, and what to use as a weapon when you are taking over another ship. Grab a cold one and pop in those 'phones. You're in for a treat.
item.itunes:subtitle: Bousaklis returns to his brothers! The Buoys have assembled for another episode of BTB.

item.title: Westville East
item.description: God Save the Queen and welcome to another episode of 3Buoys1Brunch. Today's episode takes us to Manhattan's East Village with our review of Westville! With brother Kit still enjoying the sunny shores of Californey, we invite resident Brit and all around wanker, Rhoan Oconnell to the party. We enjoyed a great brunch and then got schooled in the ways of the Classic English "fry-up" by Rhoan.
item.itunes:subtitle: God Save the Queen and welcome to another episode of 3Buoys1Brunch. Today's episode takes us to Manhattan's East Village with our review of Westville! With brother Kit still enjoying the sunny shores of Californey, we invite resident Brit and all...

item.title: Between The Brunch: Episode 13
item.description: Ok so for real tho, get ready for another steaming hot episode of Between the Brunch! This week, the Buoys are still missing their elder statesman, Kit, but the intrepid two carry on and bring you and entertaining tale none the less. We're talking weird holidays, parlor games and for some reason, Men's Wearhouse. You'll like the way we sound, we guarantee it.
item.itunes:subtitle: We're talking weird holidays, parlor games and for some reason, Men's Wearhouse. You'll like the way we sound, we garuntee it.

item.title: Montmartre
item.description: With Kit Buoy out of town, Graham and Jackson venture to Chelsea with a special guest to taste some modern French fare and get to know our new friend. Guest John Ashenden of The Benediction (an eggs Benedict blog) joins us at Montmartre, teaches us how to say the restaurants name correctly, and talks to us about how to spot a great eggs Benedict. Brunch in New York can be so much more fun with 3Buoys1Brunch.
item.itunes:subtitle: With Kit Buoy out of town, Graham and Jackson venture to Chelsea with a special guest to taste some modern French fare and get to know our new friend. Guest John Ashenden of The Benediction (an eggs Benedict blog) joins us at Montmartre,...

item.title: Between The Brunch: Episode 12
item.description: Welcome to another episode of Between the Brunch! What a couple of weeks it has been since our last Brunch outing. So much to discuss! This week: we talk about a piano miracle, break down the New York restaurant rating system, give you a little taste of our next brunch with Crazy Yelp Reviews, and top it all off with another edition of Jack Buoy's Nautical Facts. Keep your ears glued to your earpods, you might just notice something wasn't quite right with Kit on this one.
item.itunes:subtitle: Welcome to another episode of Between the Brunch! What a couple of weeks it has been since our last Brunch outing. So much to discuss! This week: we talk about a piano miracle, break down the New York restaurant rating system, give you a little taste...

item.title: Lexington Brass - One Year Anniversary
item.description: And finally we have arrived. One year strong with your Brothers Buoy. This intrepid three ventures today to a classy establishing in Midtown, Lexington Brass. Check out the episode to see what we thought but stick around to hear a year in review and our awards for best in show categories. Also the winner of our contest is announced!
item.itunes:subtitle: Listen as the Brother's Buoy dine in Midtown on the one year anniversary of 3Buoys1Brunch!

item.title: Between the Brunch : Episode 11
item.description: Get your arses ready for this week's Between the Brunch. In this episode, the Brother's Buoy get a little Oscar fever, discuss the apparent end of "bottomless drinks", suggest some new apps and music, Jack Buoy drops knowledge about anchors, and the Buoys get an anniversary gift from some awesome ladies. Don't forget that the anniversary contest is still on, so if you want your ass in it, then hop over to iTunes and leave 3Buoys1Brunch a written review. The user names will be piled together and three lucky folks will be pulled at random to receive prizes!
item.itunes:subtitle: The Brother's Buoys slap your ear holes with another round of Between the Brunch.

item.title: Sparrow Tavern
item.description: The moment has finally come. It is the honor of The Brother's Buoy to have the fine gents from a Podcasterbating  join them at the brunch table. Podcasterbating is a fellow podcast staring Ace and Herm and drops every tuesday on iTunes and Sticher. They cover a huge range of topics and tell it like it is. Today's episode finds the Buoys in Queens yet again at Sparrow Tavern. Listen to find out how the Buoys and their guests felt about this little gem in Astoria.
item.itunes:subtitle: Valentine's Day Brunch with Ace and Herm from Podcasterbating!!!

item.title: Between the Brunch : Episode 10
item.description: Come one, come all to another thick and nasty episode of Between the Brunch! This week marks the tenth BTB, so the Buoys pull out all the stops and deliver a bevy of new segments as well as the announcement of their one year celebration contest! To see rules for entry, and also fill your ear holes with sweet milky Buoys, give a listen! Your brain (and loins) will thank you.
item.itunes:subtitle: Ready yourselves for a hefty 10th episode of Between the Brunch!

item.title: La Giara
item.description: I hope you're ready for another first. This time around the Brother's Buoy find their way to La Giara in Murray Hill to have their first Italian brunch experience. Stay tuned after the reviews to hear the Buoy's take a step back from their normal antics to tackle a touchy subject. Also, listen as they give your ear holes an announcement about a collaboration that is not too far away.
item.itunes:subtitle: The first Italian restaurant for the Brother's Buoy

item.title: Between the Brunch : Episode 9
item.description: It's a birthday episode for this episode of Between the Brunch! Listen as the Buoys celebrate the middle child of the group by discussing a wide range of current events ranging from an unfair legal system to a crazy Canadian. There is also another round of "Google it", some awesome app and music recommendations and Jack Buoy's nautical fact of the week.
item.itunes:subtitle: HAPPY BIRTHDAY TO GRAHAM BUOY!!!

item.title: Cornerstone Cafe
item.description: It's January 24th and it's also the first brunch post of 2014! You've been double fisting Between the Brunch episodes for long enough. Listen as the Brother's Buoy make their way to Cornerstone Cafe in the East Village of ol' Manhattan to give their two cents on a straight-forward dining experience. Stay tuned after the reviews to hear each Buoy's first experience with the most respected plant in all of human history.
item.itunes:subtitle: You've waited for a few weeks, but your troubles are now over. Here's the first brunch post of 2014.

item.title: Between the Brunch : Episode 8
item.description: There comes a time in which those Buoys have to fill your ear holes with back to back Between the Brunch epsiodes....this is one of those times. Listen to find out their thoughts on pimping in Jordans, "What's the deal with" group texts and another round of Jack Buoys nautical facts. Also, they've thrown in a helping of the new "Google it" segment as well as a discussion about a huge music festival and an adicctive app recommendation.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Buoys are starting the year off with two BTBs!

item.title: Between the Brunch : Episode 7
item.description: Happy New Year to you and yours from the Brothers Buoy! To kick off 2014 those Buoys have decided to pile on a few current even topics ranging from a bastard of a governor to a health conscious science teacher. There is a "what's the deal with" that most people will level with and also a new interactive segment....Rest easy, the Buoys are back.
item.itunes:subtitle: The first BTB of the new year!

item.title: General Greene
item.description: Oh awesome! Better late than never, the Buoys are at one again with a trip out to a new hood: Fort Greene. And where better to introduce this new region than to a trip to the General Greene. In this episode the Buoys flip the script and talk about a current event in lieu of discussing a topic related to the restaurant and boy is this one a doosey! Listen if you dare?
item.itunes:subtitle: The General Greene in Fort Greene..also, one of the best post brunch discussions that the Brothers have had in a while.

item.title: Robertas
item.description: Those Brother's Buoy decide that it's about that time to hit up Bushwick again. They find themselves in what appears to be a hole in the wall, but alas, it is Roberta's. This place is a hipsters wet dream and it would be a disservice to the planet of earth if they did not see what all the buzz is all about. This episode's topic comes with a rare twist. The Buoys bring on three special guests to talk about their favorite Xmas movies of all time.
item.itunes:subtitle: Those Buoys are visiting Roberta's in Bushwick and they brought along some guests...

item.title: Between the Brunch : Episode 6
item.description: Those Brothers Buoy are back once again to discuss life Between the Brunch. Todays topics include the horrible decisions of the Salvation Army, ridiculousness on the subway, an awesome nautical fact and a list of some noteworthy apps to check out.
item.itunes:subtitle: The sixth episode of Between the Brunch!

item.title: Queens Comfort
item.description: Who says that those Brothers Buoy only partake in brunch in two boroughs? Well, you were right until now! Today's episode finds the 3 Buoys in Queens as they venture to Astoria to checkout Queens Comfort (40-09 30 Avenue). Listen as they try a new review strategy, but don't forget to stay tuned past the reviews to hear the topic of today: What are your favorite childhood toys?...
item.itunes:subtitle: The Buoys hit up their third borough as they try out Queens Comfort in Astoria

item.title: Between the Brunch : Episode 5
item.description: Good lord. Get ready for what is possibly the brothers buoy thanksgiving spectacular. This is truly a window into the whirlwind life of your favorite brothers when they really cut lose and let their hair down for the holidays. So put down the credit card and try and relax if you can to this episode of Between the Brunch:Brothers Buoy Thanksgiving Special.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Brother's Buoy Thanksgiving Special

item.title: Amy Ruths
item.description: For those of you who think that the Buoys stay camped out in Brooklyn we have something for you today. Graham chose Amy Ruth's in Harlem (113 W 116th Steet New York, NY 10026) for today's adventure. Listen as we attempt to fight major cases of the itis rather than drunkeness. Stay tuned after the reviews to find out each Buoy's best pass-out story due to the state that the food of Amy Ruth's put us in.
item.itunes:subtitle: Getting a major case of the itis in Harlem at Amy Ruth's

item.title: Between the Brunch : Episode 4
item.description: Oh Christ alive, it's time again for your Buoys to talk about all things not brunch in another episode of Between the Brunch! So strap in, Junior, and bring Aunt Agnes too and listen to the Buoys tackle the tough topics of today! This week: elevator assholes and the many ways we wish death upon them, literal battle of the bands in Brooklyn and a nautical fact that will make your friend Jonah hate us forever. Download now!
item.itunes:subtitle: The 4th episode of Between the Brunch!

item.title: Sweet Chick
item.description: Today, the Brother's Buoy were back in Brooklyn to check out Sweet Chick in Williamsburg. They seem to gravitate toward Bedford avenue, but don't fret, they will get to as many locales as possible. Listen after the reviews to find out embarrassing stories from the Buoy's childhood.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Buoys were back in Brooklyn to check out Sweet Chick in Williamsburg

item.title: Good Enough to Eat
item.description: Today, those Brothers Buoy traveled to Manhattan to visit Good Enough to Eat (520 Columbus Avenue New York, NY) in the Upper West Side. The food was great and the drinks were solid. Listen after the reviews to hear what each Buoy thinks is good enough to eat, yet can't be eaten.
item.itunes:subtitle: Kit looked to "Good enough to Eat" in the Upper West Side for today's brunch

item.title: Between the Brunch : Episode 3
item.description: You're welcome, to another episode of Between the Brunch with your intrepid Brothers Buoy. This week, the Bros will treat you kindly with their post Halloween Hangover Edition! They review Halloween candy (which is now on sale!), discuss the Jolly Rodger and talk about the absurdity of not giving out candy on Halloween. Pop a few Asprin and check it out!
item.itunes:subtitle: A Halloween special of Between the Brunch

item.title: Sage
item.description: What's up everyone? Today those Buoys decided to switch it up a little. They ventured to Sage in Williamsburg (299-301 Graham Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11211) to get a Thai twist on brunch. That wasn't the only thing enticing those brothers. Sage is one of the establishments that is a part of the Vintage Crawl,which is a self guided tour through awesome neighborhoods in Brooklyn. For more info about the crawl, check out vintagecrawl.com.
item.itunes:subtitle: Visiting Sage in Williamsburg

item.title: Between The Brunch : Episode 2
item.description: Hey everyone, your Buoys are back with another installment of Between the Brunch. This week: horror in a hand bag, premium rush on Citi Bike and why you shouldn't bring bananas on your next trip out to sea. All this and more! Have a listen!
item.itunes:subtitle: The second installment of Between The Brunch!

item.title: The Smith
item.description: Today, Graham chose The Smith in the East Village as the destination for The Brothers Buoy to check out. It has been awhile since those nutty bastards treked over to Manhattan, but the travel was worth it. After todays reveiws, stay tuned to find  out which decade each Buoy loves over all.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Smith in the East Village

item.title: Between the Brunch : Episode 1
item.description: Oh my! What's this? The Buoys have something new up their sleeve! A new podcast, and they're not at brunch? Welcome to "Between the Brunch." A shorter, bi-weekly moment with your favorite bros where they cover very current events, a new segment called "What's the Deal With..." and more nautical facts than you can shake a stick at. It's Buoys every week! From now on! Rejoice! This week: Motorcycle Madness in NYC, tipping at fast food places, the new HAIM album, and only a very little bit about the government shut-down!
item.itunes:subtitle: The Buoys have something new up their sleeve! A new podcast, and they're not at brunch? Welcome to "Between the Brunch."

item.title: Le Barricou
item.description: Today, Jackson picked Le Barricou in Williamsburg (533 Grand St, Brooklyn, NY 11211). We were in Brooklyn yet again, but don't worry, we will try our best to hit up the whole city (and country???). If you have any recommendations you can post them on our Facebook page.../3buoys1brunch or just email us at 3buoys1brunch@gmail.com if you are shy.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week, The Brothers Buoy decided to get a dose of french cuisine at Le Barricou in Williamsburg

item.title: Trix
item.description: Today, Kit chose Trix (145 Bedford Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11249) up in Williamsburg as our brunch destination. After today's audio reviews we discussed our favorite cereals and porn stars based on the name of today's restaurant, Trix.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week, we're up in Trix!

item.title: Allswell
item.description: Today Graham picked Allswell (124 Bedford Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11211) as our brunch spot for the day. If you stay tuned past the audio reviews, you will get to hear our topic of the day: “What’s your favorite comeback story?”. Todays choice was picked because we had not gone to brunch in a long time and are now back together. This is our tenth post and we are lucky to have a good friend who shall be referred to as “J Bleu” write some Buoy inspired music for us.
item.itunes:subtitle: 10th post of 3B1B!!!

item.title: Fort Defiance
item.description: Today Jackson picked Fort Defiance (365 Van Brunt St, Brooklyn, NY 11231) as our brunch spot for the day. If you stay tuned past the audio reviews, you will get to hear our topic of the day: “Who is your favorite general and why?”. Todays choice was inspired by the name of our brunch spot.
item.itunes:subtitle: Today Jackson picked Fort Defiance (365 Van Brunt St, Brooklyn, NY 11231) as our brunch spot for the day. If you stay tuned past the audio reviews, you will get to hear our topic of the day: âWho is your favorite general and why?â. Todays choice was i

item.title: Juliette
item.description: Oh that Juliette, still making us her love slaves. We’re up in Williamsburg for a second round of a solid brunch spot, Juliette. After our audio reviews, our topic of discussion was: “What is your favorite tragedy?”.
item.itunes:subtitle: Oh that Juliette, still making us her love slaves. Weâre up in Williamsburg for a second round of a solid brunch spot, Juliette. After our audio reviews, our topic of discussion was: âWhat is your favorite tragedy?â.

item.title: Northern Spy
item.description: After a brief hiatus, those ol’ Brothers Buoy are at it again. This time around we decided to check out Northern Spy, which was Graham’s pick. The weather was crappy again, but that did not put a damper on our appetites. This episodes topic after our audio review is, “What’s your favorite spy movie?" based on the name the restaurant this week.
item.itunes:subtitle: After a brief hiatus, those olâ Brothers Buoy are at it again. This time around we decided to check out Northern Spy, which was Grahamâs pick. The weather was crappy again, but that did not put a damper on our appetites. This episodes topic after our

item.title: Northeast Kingdom
item.description: Today we were in for a nice treat. Jackson picked Northeast Kingdom (18 Wyckoff Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11237) as our brunch spot for the day and the Buoys seemed to have a great time.If you stay tuned past the reviews, you will get to hear our topic of the day: Who are your favorite fantasy characters and why?Todays choice was inspired by the name of our brunch spot.
item.itunes:subtitle: Today we were in for a nice treat. Jackson picked Northeast Kingdom up in ol' Bushwick.

item.title: Mesa Coyoacan
item.description: Today, those ol' Buoys were in Williamsburg to check out Mesa Coyoacan (372 Graham Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11211) and dine on some Mexican eats and drinks. If you stay tuned after the audio reviews, you will hear todays topic: What superhero would you be based on their powers and why?
item.itunes:subtitle: Today, those olâ Buoys were in Williamsburg to check out Mesa Coyoacan

item.title: Mogador
item.description: This week, your buoys found their way to Cafe Mogador : 101 St Marks Pl, New York, NY 10009. Mother Nature was in the mood to make it rain and your Buoys were more intoxicated than ever before.
item.itunes:subtitle: Graham chose Mogador, up in the East Village for today's adventure.

item.title: Superfine
